maple.backend.singularity package¶

Submodules¶

maple.backend.singularity.container module¶

Python API for singularity interface in maple

maple.backend.singularity.container.commit(image)¶

Commit changes from local container to local image

maple.backend.singularity.container.execute(command)¶

Run local image in a container

maple.backend.singularity.container.list()¶

List all containers on system

maple.backend.singularity.container.notebook(image, port='8888')¶

Launch ipython notebook inside the container

maple.backend.singularity.container.pour(image, options='--no-home')¶

Pour local image in a container, opposite of maple rinse

maple.backend.singularity.container.rinse(container='None', rinse_all=False)¶

Stop and remove the local container, opposite of maple pour

maple.backend.singularity.container.run(image, command)¶

Run and rinse the local container

maple.backend.singularity.container.shell()¶

Get shell access to the local container

maple.backend.singularity.image module¶

Python API for singularity interface in maple

maple.backend.singularity.image.build(target, base, as_root=False)¶

Builds a local image from remote image

Parameters

  • target (Name of the local image to be built) –

  • base (Name of the base image) –

  • as_root (Build image as root (True/False)) –

maple.backend.singularity.image.delete(image)¶

Delete an image

maple.backend.singularity.image.list()¶

List all images on system

maple.backend.singularity.image.pull(target, base)¶

Pull remote image

Parameters

  • target (target image to pull into) –

  • base (base image in remote registry) –

maple.backend.singularity.image.push(base, target)¶

Push local image to remote tag/image

Parameters

  • base (base image) –

  • target (target image to push) –

maple.backend.singularity.image.scan(image)¶

Scan an image

maple.backend.singularity.image.squash(image)¶

Squash an image and remove layers

maple.backend.singularity.image.tag(base, target)¶

Tag a target image from base image

Parameters

  • base (base image) –

  • target (target image to push) –
